titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

bioghist.p: The Stout Collection at the Genealogical Society of Pennsylvania has its genesis in November 1990 when Reverend Edmond Stout donated substantially all of his extensive personal collection of family research. He also established a trust to be used to purchase, acquire, accession books and other Stout genealogical materials. The early research and German ancestry work in the collection was begun by RADM Herald F. Stout, U.S.N. Retired, San Diego, California.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes genealogical research and other information about many members of the Stout family. Materials include: listing of Stout family members; family charts and datasheets; correspondence; photocopies of clippings and primary sources; notes and extracts from marriage records, court records, church records and other sources; issues of the Stout family newsletter; bound, published family histories; copies of photographs, obituaries, churches, and other information related to various family members; and a small number of slides. There is also information about the Stout Collection at GSP, including an explanation of the numbering scheme and a handout describing the trust and the collection.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
